Subject: English
VerbsDescription:
Please note there is no definitive list of verbs used by the examination panel to explore the way in which meaning is conveyed by an author and new terms are regularly introduced.
Students would do well to develop their understanding of such terms. Terms are often nominalised in topics and students should be prepared for this

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To make an effort to achieve, demonstrate, or convey something; to try to accomplish a particular interpretation, argument, or effect within the text

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To question, dispute, or test the validity of an idea, value, assumption, or established norm presented in or through the text

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To argue in support of or justify a position, value, character, or idea; to present evidence that upholds or protects something from criticism

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To show clearly through evidence, examples, or argument; to make evident or prove a point about the text's ideas or values

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To be the decisive factor in shaping, influencing, or controlling an outcome, character's fate, or thematic development

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To examine, investigate, or consider in depth; to look at multiple aspects, perspectives, or implications of an idea, theme, or value

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To show how two or more elements interact with, influence, and affect each other reciprocally; to examine the dynamic relationship between concepts

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To represent, depict, or characterise; to present a particular image, interpretation, or understanding of a character, setting, or idea

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To strengthen, support, or give additional weight to an idea, value, or theme; to confirm or intensify through repetition or emphasis

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To make known, uncover, or disclose something previously hidden or not immediately apparent about characters, themes, or values

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To influence, form, or determine the nature, development, or outcome of something; to mould understanding or perception

Subject: English
VerbsDefinition: To present, display, or make visible; to demonstrate through the text's content, structure, or language how something is represented

Subject: English
VerbsClosing: Or the use of a linking verb to imply there is a direct connection by use of is/are or is not/are not
